items.description_english: The best Ball with the ultimate\nperformance. It will catch any wild\nPokémon without fail.
A very high-grade Ball that offers\na higher Pokémon catch rate than\na Great Ball.
A good, quality Ball that offers\na higher Pokémon catch rate than\na standard Poké Ball.
A Ball thrown to catch a wild\nPokémon. It is designed in a\ncapsule style.
A special Ball that is used only in\nthe Safari Zone. It is finished in\na camouflage pattern.
A somewhat different Ball that\nworks especially well on Water- and\nBug-type Pokémon.
A somewhat different Ball that\nworks especially well on Pokémon\ndeep in the sea.
A somewhat different Ball that\nworks especially well on weaker\nPokémon.
A somewhat different Ball that\nworks especially well on Pokémon\ncaught before.
A somewhat different Ball that\nbecomes progressively better the\nmore turns there are in a battle.
A comfortable Ball that makes a\ncaptured wild Pokémon quickly grow\nfriendly.
A rare Ball that has been\nspecially made to commemorate an\nevent of some sort.
An eerie-looking Ball that\nworks especially well on Pokémon\nfound in dark places.
A remedial Ball that restores\ncaught Pokémon.
A somewhat different Ball that\nworks incredibly well if thrown\non the first turn.
A very rare Ball that is\nmade in commemoration\nof certain events.
A hand-crafted Ball that\nworks especially well on\nfast Pokémon.
A hand-crafted Ball that\nworks especially well on lower\nlevel Pokémon.
A hand-crafted Ball that\nworks especially well on fished\nup Pokémon.
A hand-crafted Ball that\nworks especially well on\nheavy Pokémon.
A hand-crafted Ball that\nworks especially well on Pokémon\nof the opposite gender.
A hand-crafted Ball that\nmakes a captured wild Pokémon\nquickly grow friendly.
A hand-crafted Ball that\nworks especially well on Pokémon\nthat evolve with a Moon Stone.
A special Poké Ball that is used\nduring the Bug-Catching Contest.
A special Poké Ball that appears\nin your Bag in the Entree Forest.\nIt can catch any Pokémon.
A spray-type wound medicine.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 20 points.
A spray-type wound medicine.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 50 points.
A spray-type wound medicine.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 200 points.
A spray-type wound medicine.\nIt fully restores the HP of one\nPokémon.
A medicine that fully restores the\nHP and heals any status problems\nof one Pokémon.
A medicine that revives a fainted\nPokémon, restoring HP by half the\nmaximum amount.
A medicine that revives a fainted\nPokémon, restoring HP fully.
Water with a high mineral content.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 50 points.
A fizzy soda drink.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 60 points.
A very sweet drink.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 80 points.
Highly nutritious milk.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 100 points.
A very bitter medicine powder.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 50 points.
A very bitter root.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 200 points.
A very bitter medicine powder.\nIt heals all the status problems of\none Pokémon.
A very bitter medicinal herb.\nIt revives a fainted Pokémon,\nrestoring HP fully.
A spray-type medicine.\nIt heals one Pokémon from a\npoisoning.
A spray-type medicine.\nIt heals one Pokémon from\nparalysis.
A spray-type medicine.\nIt heals one Pokémon of a burn.
A spray-type medicine.\nIt defrosts a frozen Pokémon.
A spray-type medicine.\nIt awakens a sleeping Pokémon.
A spray-type medicine.\nIt heals all the status problems of\none Pokémon.
Restores a selected move's PP by\n10 points for one Pokémon.
Fully restores a selected move's PP\nfor one Pokémon.
Restores the PP of all moves for\none Pokémon by 10 points each.
Fully restores the PP of all moves\nfor one Pokémon.
A 100% pure juice.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 20 points.
Revives all fainted Pokémon,\nrestoring HP fully.
A sweet chocolate heart.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 20 points.
A famous candy in Mahagony Town.\nIt restores the HP of one Pokémon\nby 20 points.
Lavaridge Town's local specialty.\nIt heals all the status problems of\none Pokémon.
Old Chateau's hidden specialty.\nIt heals all the status problems of\none Pokémon.
Castelia City's specialty, soft-serve\nice cream. It heals all the status\nproblems of one Pokémon.
A popular treat in Lumiose City.\nIt heals all the status problems of\none Pokémon.
Shalour City's famous shortbread.\nIt heals all the status problems of\none Pokémon.
A nutritious drink for Pokémon.\nIt raises the base HP of one\nPokémon.

A nutritious drink for Pokémon.\nIt raises the base Defense stat of\none Pokémon.

A nutritious drink for Pokémon.\nIt raises the base Speed stat of\none Pokémon.
Slightly raises the maximum PP of\na selected move for one Pokémon.
Raises the PP of a selected move\nto its maximum level for one\nPokémon.
An item that raises\nthe base HP of one\nPokémon.
An item that raises\nthe base Attack stat\nof one Pokémon.

A mysterious capsule\nthat can change a\nPokémon's ability.
A mysterious patch\nthat can give a Pokémon\nit's hidden ability.

A candy that is packed with energy.\nIt raises the level of a Pokémon\nby one.
A blue glass flute that awakens\na sleeping Pokémon.
A yellow glass flute that snaps one\nPokémon out of confusion.
A red glass flute that snaps one\nPokémon out of infatuation.
A black glass flute.\nWhen blown, it makes wild Pokémon\nless likely to appear.
A white glass flute.\nWhen blown, it makes wild Pokémon\nmore likely to appear.
Prevents weak wild Pokémon from\nappearing for 100 steps.
Prevents weak wild Pokémon from\nappearing for 200 steps.
Prevents weak wild Pokémon from\nappearing for 250 steps.
A long, durable rope.\nUse it to escape instantly from a\ncave or a dungeon.
Raises the Attack stat of Pokémon\nin battle. Wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.
Raises the Defense stat of Pokémon\nin battle. Wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.
Raises the Sp.Atk. stat of\nPokémon in battle. Wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.
Raises the Sp.Def. stat of\nPokémon in battle. Wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.
Raises the Speed stat of Pokémon\nin battle. Wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.
Raises the accuracy stat of\nPokémon in battle. Wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.
Raises the critical-hit ratio of\nPokémon in battle. Wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.
An item that prevents stat reduction\namong party Pokémon for five turns\nafter use.
An attractive doll.\nUse it to flee from any battle with\na wild Pokémon.
An attractive item.\nUse it to flee from any battle with\na wild Pokémon.
An attractive item.\nUse it to flee from any battle with\na wild Pokémon.
A nugget of pure gold that gives\noff a lustrous gleam.\nIt can be sold at a high price.
A big nugget of pure gold that\ngives off a lustrous gleam.\nIt can be sold at a high price.
A small and rare mushroom.\nIt is quite popular among certain\npeople.
A large and rare mushroom.\nIt is very popular among certain\npeople.
A large and rare mushroom.\nIt is very popular among certain\npeople.
A relatively small pearl that\nsparkles in a pretty silver color.\nIt can be sold cheaply.
A quite-large pearl that sparkles\nin a pretty silver color.\nIt can be sold at a high price.
Quite-large pearls that sparkle\nin a pretty silver color.\nThey can be sold at a high price.
A pretty red sand with a loose,\nsilky feel.\nIt can be sold at a high price.
A shard of a pretty gem that\nsparkles in a red color.\nIt can be sold at a high price.
A shard of a fallen comet that\nshines in a blue color.\nIt can be sold at a high price.
Pure salt obtained from deep inside\nthe Shoal Cave. It is extremely\nsalty.
A pretty seashell found deep inside\nthe Shoal Cave. It is striped in\nblue and white.
A small red shard.\nIt appears to be from some sort of\na tool made long ago.
A small blue shard.\nIt appears to be from some sort of\na tool made long ago.
A small yellow shard.\nIt appears to be from some sort of\na tool made long ago.
A small green shard.\nIt appears to be from some sort of\na tool made long ago.
A pretty, heart-shaped scale that\nis extremely rare. It glows faintly\nin the colors of a rainbow.
Deliciously sweet honey that\nwill attract wild Pokémon\nwhen used.
A very rare bone.\nIt can be sold at\na high price.
A vital item that is needed to keep a\nstone tower from collapsing. Voices\ncan be heard from it occasionally.
A beautiful yet\n plain feather that\ndoes nothing.
A copper coin used in a civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.\nIt sells at a high price.
A silver coin used in a civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.\nIt sells at a high price.
A gold coin used in a civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.\nIt sells at a high price.
A vase made in a civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.\nIt sells at a high price.
A bracelet made in a civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.\nIt sells at a high price.
A stone figure made in a civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.\nIt sells at a high price.
A crown made in a civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.\nIt sells at a high price.
An ornament depicting a Pokémon\nthat is venerated as a protector\nin the Alola region.
A fossil of an ancient, seafloor-\ndwelling Pokémon. It appears to be\npart of a seashell.
A fossil of an ancient, seafloor-\ndwelling Pokémon. It appears to be\npart of a shell.
A piece of amber that contains\nthe genes of an ancient Pokémon.\nIt is clear with a reddish tint.
A fossil of an ancient, seafloor-\ndwelling Pokémon. It appears to be\npart of a plant root.
A fossil of an ancient, seafloor-\ndwelling Pokémon. It appears to be\npart of a claw.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat lived on the land. It appears\nto be part of a collar.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat lived on the land. It appears\nto be part of a head.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat lived in the sea. It appears\nto be a part of its back.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat lived in the sky. It appears\nto be a part of its wing.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat lived on the land. It appears\nto be part of a large jaw.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat lived on the land. It looks\nlike the impression from a skin sail.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nIt speeds up the growth of Berries.\nHowever, it also dries the soil faster.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nIt slows the growth of Berries and\ncauses the soil to dry slower.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nIt extends the time ripened Berries\nremain on their plants before falling.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nIt ups the number of times new plants\ngrow where mature plants withered.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nIt increases the Berry harvest without\nthe need for particularly diligent care.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nIt causes strange, sudden mutations\nbased on the combination of Berries.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nIt increases the Berry harvest that\ncan be grown by diligent watering.
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil.\nAn amazing Mulch with the effects\nof Rich, Surprise, and Boost Mulch.
A red apricorn.\nIt assails your nostrils.
A blue apricorn.\nIt smells a bit like grass.
A yellow apricorn.\nIt has an invigorating scent.
A green apricorn.\nIt has a strange, aromatic scent.
A pink apricorn.\nIt has a nice, sweet scent.
A white apricorn.\nIt doesn't smell like anything.
A black apricorn.\nIt has an idescribable scent.

A stick of leek to be held by a\nFarfetch'd. It raises Farfetch'd's\ncritical-hit ratio.
A hard bone of some sort to be\nheld by a Cubone or Marowak.\nIt raises the Attack stat.
A glove to be held by a Chansey.\nIt raises Chansey's critical-hit\nratio.
A fine, hard powder to be held by\na Ditto.\nIt raises Ditto's Defense stat.
A fine, hard powder to be held by\na Ditto.\nIt raises Ditto's Speed stat.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA scale that shines a faint pink.\nIt raises the Sp.Def. stat.

A brightly gleaming orb to be\nheld by Dialga. It boosts the power\nof Dragon- and Steel-type moves.

An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt slightly boosts the power of\nWater-type moves.

An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the holding Pokémon's\nCool condition in Contests.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the holding Pokémon's\nBeauty condition in Contests.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the holding Pokémon's\nCute condition in Contests.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the holding Pokémon's\nSmart condition in Contests.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the holding Pokémon's\nTough condition in Contests.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt promotes strong growth but\nlowers Speed while it is held.
A Pokémon held item that\npromotes HP gain on leveling,\nbut reduces the Speed stat.
A Pokémon held item that\npromotes Attack gain on leveling,\nbut reduces the Speed stat.
A Pokémon held item that\npromotes Defense gain on leveling,\nbut reduces the Speed stat.
A Pokémon held item that\npromotes Sp. Atk. gain on leveling,\nbut reduces the Speed stat.
A Pokémon held item that\npromotes Sp. Def. gain on leveling,\nbut reduces the Speed stat.
A Pokémon held item that\npromotes Speed gain on leveling,\nbut reduces the Speed stat.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA sumptuous scarf that boosts the\npower of Normal-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA combustible fuel that boosts the\npower of Fire-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA teardrop-shaped gem that boosts\nthe power of Water-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA powerful magnet that boosts the\npower of Electric-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA seed imbued with life that boosts\nthe power of Grass-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA piece of ice that repels heat\nand boosts Ice-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA belt that boosts determination\nand Fighting-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA small, poisonous barb that boosts\nthe power of Poison-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA loose, silky sand that boosts the\npower of Ground-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA long, sharp beak that boosts the\npower of Flying-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA spoon imbued with telekinetic\npower boosts Psychic-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA shiny silver powder that boosts\nthe power of Bug-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nAn unbreakable stone that boosts\nthe power of Rock-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA sinister, eerie tag that boosts\nGhost-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA hard and sharp fang that boosts\nthe power of Dragon-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA shady-looking pair of glasses\nthat boosts Dark-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA special metallic film that boosts\nthe power of Steel-type moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt powers up one move, which\nbecomes the only usable one.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts Sp. Atk., but\ncan only use one move.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts Speed, but\ncan only use one move.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a bizarre orb that inflicts\na burn on the holder in battle.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a bizarre orb that badly\npoisons the holder in battle.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of Rain\nwhen caused by the holder.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of\nSunshine caused by the holder.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of\nSandstorms caused by the holder.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of Hail\nwhen caused by the holder.
A consumable bulb. If the holder\nis hit by a Water-type move,\nits Sp. Atk. will rise.
A consumable battery. If the\nholder is hit by an Electric-type\nmove, its Attack will rise.
A consumable moss. If the holder\nis hit by a Water-type move,\nits Sp. Def. will rise.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It\nboosts Attack if hit with an Ice-type\nattack. It can only be used once.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt casts a tricky glare that lowers\nthe opponent's accuracy.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt restores any lowered stat in\nbattle. It can be used only once.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holder gets a share of Exp.\npoints without having to battle.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA light and sharp claw. The holder\nmay be able to strike first.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA bell with a comforting chime that\nmakes the holder calm and friendly.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nOnly once, it snaps the holder out\nof move-binding effects.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt may cause the foe to flinch\nupon taking damage.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt doubles the battle money if the\nholding Pokémon takes part.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt repels wild Pokémon if the\nholder is first in the party.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holding Pokémon can flee from\nany wild Pokémon for sure.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holding Pokémon may endure an\nattack, leaving just 1 HP.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nAn egg filled with happiness that\nearns extra Exp. points in battle.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA lens that boosts the critical-hit\nratio of the holding Pokémon.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holding Pokémon gradually\nregains HP during battle.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holding Pokémon regains some\nHP upon striking the foe.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt's a magnifying lens that slightly\nboosts the accuracy of moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It\nis a headband that slightly boosts\nthe power of physical moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis thick pair of glasses slightly\nboosts the power of special moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It\nis a well-worn belt that slightly boosts\nthe power of supereffective moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nProtective moves like Light Screen\nand Reflect will be effective longer.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the power of moves but\nat the cost of some HP on each hit.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nOnce, it allows the immediate use of a\nmove that charges on the first turn.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nOnce while at full HP, the holder\nwill endure any attack with 1 HP.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. If\nthe holder moves after its target,\nits accuracy will be boosted.
A Pokémon held item that boosts a\nmove used consecutively. Its effect\nis reset if another move is used.
A Pokémon held item that cuts Speed.\nIt makes Flying-type and levitating\nholders susceptible to Ground moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It\nis tremendously heavy and makes\nthe holder move slower than usual.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder becomes infatuated,\nthe opposing Pokémon will be, too.
A held item that gradually restores\nthe HP of Poison-type Pokémon. It\ninflicts damage on all other types.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of multi-\nturn attacks like Bind and Wrap.
A held item that damages the holder\non every turn. It may latch on to\nPokémon that touch the holder.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. This\ndiscarded carapace allows the holder\nto switch out of battle without fail.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It\nboosts the amount of HP the holder\nrecovers from HP-stealing moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis sharply hooked claw increases\nthe holder's critical-hit ratio.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt may make foes and allies flinch\nwhen the holder inflicts damage.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It\nraises the Defense and Sp. Def. of\na Pokémon that can still evolve.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis very light stone reduces the\nweight of a Pokémon when held.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder is hit, the attacker\nwill also be damaged upon contact.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. The\nholder will float in the air until\nhit. Once hit, this item will burst.
A card with mysterious power. When\nthe holder is struck by a foe, the\nattacker is removed from battle.
Moves that would otherwise have\nno effect will land on the Pokémon\nthat holds it.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. A\nband that increases the power of\nbinding moves used by the holder.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder is hit by an attack,\nit will be switched out of battle.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. Attack\nand Sp. Atk. sharply increase if the\nholder is hit with a move it's weak to.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. This\noffensive vest raises Sp. Def. but\nprevents the use of status moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. These\ngoggles protect the holder from both\nweather-related damage and powder.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to heal paralysis.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to wake up.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to cure poison.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to heal a burn.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle for defrosting.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to restore 10 PP.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to restore 10 HP.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to lift confusion.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to heal any problem.
When held by a Pokémon, it will be\nused in battle to restore HP.
A hold item that restores HP but\nmay cause confusion when used.
A hold item that restores HP but\nmay cause confusion when used.
A hold item that restores HP but\nmay cause confusion when used.
A hold item that restores HP but\nmay cause confusion when used.
A hold item that restores HP but\nmay cause confusion when used.

The user sharpens
its claws to boost
its Attack stat
and accuracy.
Sharp, huge claws hook and slash\nthe foe quickly and with great\npower.

The user materializes
an odd psychic wave to
attack the target.
Deals physical damage.
The user calms its spirit and\nfocuses its mind to raise its\nSp.Atk. and Sp.Def. stats.
A savage roar that causes the foe\nto switch out of battle. In the\nwild, Roar ends the battle.
A move that leaves the foe badly\npoisoned. Its poison damage worsens\nevery turn.
Summons a hailstorm that lasts for\nfive turns. The hailstorm damages\nall types except the Ice type.
The user tightens all its muscles\nand bulks up, boosting both its\nAttack and Defense stats.

The user drenches the
target in a poisonous
liquid. 2x Power if
target is poisoned.
A variable move that changes type\nand power depending on the Pokémon\nusing it.
The weather is turned sunny for\nfive turns. Over that time, Fire-\ntype moves are powered up.
A taunted foe may become enraged.\nIt will then only be able to use\nattack moves.
An icy-cold beam is shot at the\nfoe. It may leave the target\nfrozen.
A vicious snow-and-wind attack that\nstrikes all foes in battle. It may\ncause freezing.
A harsh attack that inflicts severe\ndamage on the foe. However, the\nuser must rest the next turn.
A wall of light is created over\nfive turns. It reduces damage from\nSp.Atk. attacks.
The user is completely protected\nfrom attack in the turn it is used.\nIt may fail if used in succession.
A heavy rain is summoned for five\nturns. Over that time, Water-type\nmoves are powered up.

The user lands and
rests its body. It
restores HP by half
of the user's max HP.
Protects the party with a shield\nagainst all status problems over\nfive turns.
This attack move grows more\npowerful the more the Pokémon\ndislikes its Trainer.
A 2-turn attack that uses the first\nturn for absorbing sunlight, then\nblasting the foe in the next turn.

The user throws a rock
to attack a foe. A
flying Pokémon hit will
fall to the ground.
A massive jolt of electricity is\nlaunched at the foe. It may cause\nparalysis.
Strikes the foe with a huge\nthunderbolt. It may cause\nparalysis.
Causes an earthquake that strikes\nall Pokémon in battle, excluding\nthe user.
This attack move grows more\npowerful the more the Pokémon\nlikes its Trainer.
A 2-turn attack in which the user\ndigs underground, then strikes.\nIt can be used to exit dungeons.
A powerful blast of telekinetic\nenergy strikes the foe. It may\nlower the target's Sp.Def. stat.
The foe is attacked with a shadowy\nlump. It may lower the target's\nSp.Def. stat.
Strikes the foe with a rock-hard\nfist, etc. It shatters barriers such\nas Reflect and Light Screen.
The user begins moving so quickly\nthat it creates illusory copies to\nraise its evasiveness.
A tough barrier is put up over five\nturns. It reduces damage from\nphysical attacks over that time.

It swamps the area
around the user with a
giant sludge wave. It
may poison those hit.
The foe is roasted with a heavy\nblast of fire. It may leave the\ntarget with a burn.
Toxic sludge is hurled at the foe\nwith great force. It may also\npoison the target.
Summons a sandstorm that lasts for\nfive turns. It damages all types\nexcept Rock, Ground, and Steel.
The foe is incinerated with an\nintense flame. It may leave the\ntarget with a burn.
Boulders are hurled at the foe.\nIt also lowers the target's Speed\nstat if it hits.
An extremely fast attack against\none target. It is impossible to\nevade.
If enraged by this move, the target\nbecomes incapable of using the same\nmove twice in a row.
An attack move that becomes very\npowerful if the user is poisoned,\nburned, or paralyzed.

The user cloaks itself
with flame and attacks.
Building up power, it
raises the Speed stat.
A move that makes the user fall\nasleep over two turns to restore HP\nand heal any status problems.
The foe, if it is the opposite\ngender as the user, becomes\ninfatuated and may not attack.
An attack that gives the user an\nopportunity to steal the foe's hold\nitem.

The user attacks the
target's legs swiftly,
reducing the target's
Speed stat.

The user attacks the
target with a song.
Others can join in to
increase the power.

The user attacks with
an echoing voice. Its
power increases when
used every turn.
A maximum-power attack of great\nferocity, but one that also sharply\nreduces the user's Sp.Atk. stat.
The foe is struck with steel-hard\nwings. It may also raise the user's\nDefense stat.

The user attacks at
full power. It may also
lower the foe's Sp. Def.
stat if it hits.

The user draws power
from nature and fires
it at the foe. May lower
the target's Sp. Def.

A restrained attack
that always leaves
the target with at
least 1 HP.

The user shoots
boiling hot water at
its target. It may also
burn the target .

The user flings its
held item at the target.
Its power and effects
depend on the item.

The user fires an
electric charge. It
may also raise the
user's Sp. Atk. stat.

A 2-turn move hurling
the target into the air,
before dropping it. The
target cannot attack.

The user attacks the
target with fire. If
the target is holding
a Berry, it'll burn up.
The user suppresses\nthe target and makes\nits move go last.

A sinister, bluish
white flame is shot at
the target to inflict
a burn.

The user nimbly hits
the target. If the user
is not holding an item,
damage is doubled.

Prevents the target
from using held items.
Its Trainer also can't
use items on it.

Makes the target float
with its psychic power.
Attacks will always hit
the target for 3 turns.

The user slashes with
a sharp claw made from
shadows. It has a high
critical-hit ratio.

If the user can use
this attack after the
target attacks, its
power is doubled.

The user gets revenge
for a fainted ally. If
an ally fainted before,
its power is doubled.

The user charges the
foe with all its power.
It must rest on the
next turn to recover.

The user polishes its
body to reduce drag.
It sharply raises the
Speed stat.

If the foe's HP is down
to about half, this
attack will hit with
double the power.

The user stabs the
foe with a sharpened
stone. It has a high
critical-hit ratio.

After attacking, the
user rushes back to
switch places with a
party Pokémon.

The foe is attacked
with a silver dust. It
may raise all the
user's stats.

The user tackles the
foe with a high-speed
spin. The slower the user,
the greater the damage.

A move that inflicts
double damage if the
user has been hurt by
the foe this turn.

Resisting, the user
attacks the target.
The targets' Sp. Atk.
stat is reduced.

The user hypnotizes
itself into copying
any stat change made
by the target.

The user stomps down,
attacking everything
in the area. Lowers
Speed of those hit.

The user blows a cold
breath on the target.
This attack always
lands a critical hit.

Target of the opposite
gender of the user is
charmed into sharply
lowering its Sp. Atk.

The user slashes at
the foe by crossing
its scythes or claws
like a pair of scissors.

The target is knocked
away and switched.
Ends battles against
a single wild Pokémon.

The target is infested
and attacked for four
to five turns, while
the target can't flee.

Target is stabbed with
a tentacle or arm
steeped in poison. It
may poison the foe.

The user is roused,
and its Attack and
Sp. Atk. stats are
boosted.

The user snares the foe
with grass and trips it.
The heavier the foe,
the greater the damage.

A move that makes the
target confused, but
also sharply raises
its Attack.
While asleep, the user\nrandomly uses one of\nthe moves it knows.

After attacking, the
user rushes back to
switch places with a
party Pokémon.

The user pecks the
target. If it's holding
a Berry, the user eats
it and gains its effect.

The user gathers all its
light and releases it
at once. May lower the
target's Sp. Def. stat.

The user creates a
bizarre area in which
slower Pokémon get to
move first for 5 turns.

The user shrouds itself
in electricity and rams
into its target. It also
hurts the user a little.
An attack move that may have an\nadditional effect depending on the\nbattle terrain.

The user yells as if it
is ranting about some-
thing, lowering the
target's Sp. Atk. stat.

An attack that
changes type
depending on the
user's location.

The user releases a
horrible aura imbued
with dark thoughts.
Target may also flinch.

Striking foes hardens
the user's fists.
Hitting target raises
the Attack stat.

The user damages
opposing Pokémon by
emitting a powerful
flash.

The user tells the
target a secret,
and makes it lower
it's Sp. Atk. stat.
Attacks the foe with sharp blades\nor claws. It can also cut down thin\ntrees and grass outside of battle.
The user flies up on the first turn,\nthen attacks next turn. It can be\nused to fly to any known town.
Creates a huge wave, then crashes\nit down on the foe. It can be used\nfor traveling on water.
The user builds enormous power,\nthen slams the foe. It can be used\nfor moving large, round boulders.
Looses a powerful blast of light\nthat reduces the foe's accuracy.\nIt also lights up dark caves.
Hits the foe with a rock-crushingly\ntough attack. It can smash cracked\nboulders.
A powerful charge attack. It can\nbe used for climbing a torrential\nwaterfall.
A 2-turn attack in which the user\ndives underwater on the first turn,\nthen strikes in the next turn.
An oval charm said to increase\nthe chance of Eggs being found\nat the Day Care.
A shiny charm said to increase\nthe chance of finding a\nShiny Pokémon in the wild.
A flower sometimes bundled in\nbouquets to convey gratitude on\nspecial occasions like birthdays.
A mysterious glass that reveals\nthe truth. It returns a Pokémon\nback to its original shape.
A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a\ncertain Pokémon. They are said to\nhave originally been one.
A bottle believed to have been\nused to seal away the power of a\ncertain Pokémon long, long ago.
This ring contains an untold\npower that enables Pokémon\nto Mega Evolve in battle.
A folding bicycle that allows\nfaster movement than the Running\nShoes.
A folding bicycle that is at least\ntwice as fast as walking.
A folding bicycle that is capable\nof stunts like jumps and wheelies.
An old and beat-up fishing rod.\nUse it by any body of water to \nfish for wild Pokémon.
A new, good-quality fishing rod.\nUse it by any body of water to \nfish for wild Pokémon.
An awesome, high-tech fishing rod.\nUse it by any body of water to fish\nfor wild Pokémon.
A device used for finding items.\nIf there is a hidden item nearby\nwhen it is used, it emits a signal.
A very convenient map that can be\nviewed anytime. It even shows your \npresent location.
A device that indicates Trainers\nwho want to battle. The battery\ncharges while traveling.
A case that holds TMs and HMs.\nIt is attached to the Bag's\ncompartment for important items.
A pouch for carrying Berries.\nIt is attached to the Bag's\ncompartment for important items.
A case for holding Coins obtained\nat the Game Corner.\nIt holds up to 9,999 Coins.
A jar for storing Berry Powder\nmade using a Berry Crusher.
A nifty watering pail.\nUse it to promote strong growth in\nBerries planted in soft soil.
A tool that searches out Pokémon\nthat are hiding in grass. Its\nbattery is recharged as you walk.
A case for holding {POKEBLOCK}S made\nwith a Berry Blender. It releases\none {POKEBLOCK} when shaken.
A sack used to collect volcanic\nash automatically during walks\nover deep ash.
A flute that is said to instantly\nawaken any Pokémon. It has a\nlovely tone.
A device that enables you to\nrecall what you've heard and seen\nabout famous people.
A television set that is tuned to\na program with useful tips for\nnovice Trainers.
The ticket required for sailing on\nthe ferry S.S. Anne.\nIt has a drawing of a ship on it.
The ticket required for sailing on a\nferry to a distant southern island.\nIt features a drawing of an island.
A ticket required to board the ship\nto Navel Rock.\nIt glows with a mystic light.
A ticket required to board the ship\nto Birth Island.\nIt glows beautifully.
A faded sea chart that shows the\nway to a certain island.
An extremely important letter to\nSteven from the President of the\nDevon Corporation.
A package that contains mechanical\nparts of some sort made by the\nDevon Corporation.
A pair of protective goggles.\nThey enable a Trainer to travel\nthrough even desert sandstorms.
A scope that signals the presence\nof any unseeable Pokémon.\nIt is made by the Devon Corp.
The key to New Mauville, which\nwas constructed beneath Mauville\nCity.
A device used to search for\nlife-forms in water.\nIt looks too difficult to use.
A key that opens the storage hold\ninside the Abandoned Ship.\nIt is old and looks easily broken.
A key that opens the door to Room\n1 inside the Abandoned Ship.\nIt is old and looks easily broken.
A key that opens the door to Room\n2 inside the Abandoned Ship.\nIt is old and looks easily broken.
A key that opens the door to Room\n4 inside the Abandoned Ship.\nIt is old and looks easily broken.
A key that opens the door to Room\n6 inside the Abandoned Ship.\nIt is old and looks easily broken.
A meteorite that fell from space\nonto Mt. Moon long ago.\nIt is very lumpy and hard.
A medal-like item in the same\nshape as Team Magma's mark.
The pass required for entering\nPokémon Contests. It has a\ndrawing of an award ribbon on it.
A parcel to be delivered to Prof.\nOak from Viridian City's Pokémon\nMart.
The key to Cinnabar Island Gym's\nfront door. It is colored red and\ndecorated.
Take this voucher to the Bike Shop\nin Cerulean City and exchange it\nfor a bicycle.
A set of false teeth lost by the\nSafari Zone's Warden. It makes his\nsmile sparkle.
A card-type key that unlocks doors\nin Silph Co.'s Head Office in\nSaffron City.
A key that operates the elevator\nin Team Rocket's Hideout.\nIt bears the Team Rocket logo.
A scope that makes unseeable\nPokémon visible.\nIt is made by Silph Co.
A pass for ferries between One,\nTwo, and Three Island.\nIt has a drawing of three islands.
A pass for ferries between\nVermilion and the Sevii Islands.\nIt features a drawing of a rainbow.
